conclusion: When the light source slides forward, each shadow reacts in two ways: position and size.
The foot of every shadow moves rearward on the floor, opposite the motion of the lamp.
The shadows stretch and grow longer as the lamp comes closer to the objects.
Shadow A slides to the rear of the ornamental frame and grows noticeably longer.
Shadow B slides rearward behind the postcard holder and lengthens moderately.
Shadow C slides rearward and grows the most because the kimono-shaped vase is tall.
Shadow D translates rearward and becomes longer, with growth between B and C.
Every shadow shifts away from the lamp and becomes longer, with C showing the greatest increase in length, B the least, and A and D in between.
